place.name: TURVILLE
place.gazetteerText: TURVILLE, a parish, with a village, in Wycombe district, Bucks; 5 miles SW by W of West Wycombe r. station. Post town, Watlington, under Tetsworth. Acres, 2,315. Real property, £2,281. Pop., 437. Houses, 91. The property is subdivided. T. Court is the seat ofScholefield, Esq. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Oxford. Value, £107.* Patron, R. Ovey, Esq. The church is tolerable. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
